Job details

Fleet Director needed for well-established company that helps to provide beatification services for large scale business and enterprise companies in 6 states

This Jobot Job is hosted by Joseph Calabrese

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $150,000 - $180,000 per year

A Bit About Us

We are a major leader in the commercial landscape industry, providing full-service landscape maintenance for commercial, multi-family, industrial and municipal properties. With offices in California, Texas, Colorado, Oregon and Washington, the firm strives to develop maximum value for its clients' budgets and provide timely project delivery, clear consistent communications, and proactive property improvement recommendations.



Why join us?


  • Ability to join a stable well-established company / job security
  • Company Provided Life/AD&D
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • 7 Paid Holidays
  • 3 Days Paid Bereavement
  • 5 Days Paid Jury Duty
  • Employee Equity Program
  • Paid Time Off Starting at 2 weeks per year
  • Sick Pay in accordance with applicable state or local ordinance
  • On-Demand Pay Through A Partnership with DailyPay
  • Referral Bonuses Programs

Job Details

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Logistics or Finance preferred

Experience

  • Minimum of 8-10 years of related work experience
  • Minimum of 5 years in a senior Fleet Management or comparable role
  • License or Certification

As required by state and federal law

  • Valid driver's license
  • Relevant training and/or certifications as a Fleet Manager

Specialized Skills

  • Extensive experience in Fleet, Procurement, and Facilities management
  • Proven track record as a Director of Fleet or in a similar executive role
  • Expertise in working with and maintaining databases, including proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other relevant tools
  • Exceptional ability to conceptualize and execute large-scale projects, foreseeing challenges and addressing operational needs
  • Strategic and tactical thinking capabilities
  • Proven experience in optimizing all facets of fleet operations through process streamlining and securing the best prices for inventory
  • Analytical mindset with strong business acumen
  • Effective problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Outstanding organizational ability
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills for collaboration with various departments
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly to changes
  • Proficiency in multitasking and effective task prioritization

Essential Duties

  • Lead the strategic purchase and maintenance of vehicles for deliveries
  • Conduct research to determine the most cost-efficient procedures for vehicle acquisition, whether through leasing or purchasing
  • Negotiate and secure best-price contracts to optimize business revenue
  • Drive continuous improvement in all aspects of the fleet operations department by evaluating and enhancing existing methodologies and processes
  • Promote a positive corporate image and foster strong inter-business relationships with partners
  • Maintain professional relationships with vendors, championing company initiatives and values
  • Oversee inventory procedures to ensure accuracy and efficiency
  • Implement cost-cutting strategies and initiatives to maximize profit margins
  • Maintain comprehensive vehicle servicing records and ensure operational efficiency across the fleet year-round
  • Collaborate closely with Drivers and Auto Mechanics to ensure seamless operations and adherence to company standards
  • Develop efficient driver schedules to optimize profits
  • Manage drivers to ensure strict adherence to schedules
  • Register and license all vehicles under management
  • Develop and implement strategies for enhanced fuel efficiency
  • Maintain detailed records of vehicle servicing and inspections
  • Play a key role in the recruitment of high-quality drivers into the fleet
